topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Managing Object Storage (Swift) Rings

body.p: The rings are a machine-readable description of which disk drives are used by Swift (for example, a drive is used to store account or object data). Rings also specify the policy for data storage (for example, defining the number of replicas). The rings are automatically built during the initial deployment of the system, with the configuration provided during setup of the HP Helion OpenStack Input Model. (For more information, see .)

After successful deployment of your cloud, you may want to change or modify the configuration for Swift. For example, you may want to add or remove Swift nodes, add additional storage policies, or upgrade the size of disk drives. For instructions, see Applying Input Model Changes to Existing Rings and Adding a New Storage Policy - Swift.

p.note: The process of modifying or adding a configuration is similar to other configuration or topology change in the cloud. Generally, you make the changes to the input model files at ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/ and run Ansible playbooks to reconfigure the system.

body.p: Changes to the rings require several phases to complete the process of deployment. Therefore, you may need to run the playbooks several times over several days.
